result.execSummary:
The defendant Paul S. Schraven was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Term of Imprisonment ordered as to Waushara Co Case No. 2014CF000183

superMiscConds.notes: Court orders the fines, costs, and restitution in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy, not to exceed 25% of gross during the term of initial confinement. If any fines, costs, and/or restitution remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

Defendant is prohibited from having any contact with any females under the age of 18 years, unless in the immediate presence of a parent or guardian.   Defendant is also prohibited from using any computer, Internet and/or any social media now in existence or in the future

Defendant to comply with the Sex Offender Registration Program.  Registration is a lifelong requirement.  Complete a Sex Offender Treatment Assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the Supervising Agent.  DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

The following uncharged referrals were dismissed and read-in at the plea hearing on April 14, 2015:  14WS8337 (Victim H.N.S.) with an offense date of 2004 to 2006; 15WS805 (Victim A.G.) with an offense date of Spring of 2014; and 14WS1385 (Victim A.M.S.) with an offense date of about 02/13/2014 through on or about 02/26/2014.

records.addlTxt: 14CF-35 and 14CF-183 - Both Cases Called @ 2:45 PM: Defendant Paul S. Schraven in court with attorney Matthew Loren Goldin.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel admit receipt of PSI report.  Atty Goldin speaks to factual corrections of PSI.  DA finds no materials errors as to PSI.  Reminds the Court of uncharged read-ins and all victims present today.  State will read in a written statement from HSN as appropriate.  Statement read for the record by the DA.  Court has previously reviewed all other Victim Statements filed with the Court.  Argument by DA as to SEH - argues for a deviation from DOC recommendation.  DA will stipulate to 487 days TS credit as to each count.  Argument by Atty Goldin.  Statement by Def:  Yes.  The Court:  All Counts 6 Cts total - 17 yr period of imprisonment - bifurcated - 7 yr IC/10 yr ES.  Each sentence concurrent to one another - both cases concurrent to one another.  487 days TS credit.  Conditions of ES:  Complete SOT program; Register as a Sex Offender for life - lifelong registry appropriate in this instance; No contact whatsoever with any females under the age of 18 yrs unless in the immediate presence of parent or guardian; No use of computer, Internet or any social media now in existence or in the future; Costs of action, by law must include a $500 surcharge not on each count - one surcharge per case imposed - 2 surcharges total; Any earnings during IC - 25% be devoted to costs imposed; DNA sample ordered to be provided and surcharge assessed - surcharge assessed as to each count.  Appeal Rights Given.

Case called @ 2:42 p.m. Defendant Paul S. Schraven in court with attorney Matthew L Goldin.  Defendant Paul S. Schraven in custody.  Scott C Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The court entertains waiver of the preliminary hearing. The court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant bound over for trial. Information filed by DA Blader. Motion by Atty Goldin for modification of the bond amount as well as the no contact provisions of bond. DA Blader voices an objection to any bond modification. The court will modify the bond to permit contact as already allowed but will allow contact in writing as well.  Arraignment scheduled for April 21, 2014 at 11:45 am.
and Order for Telephonic Testimony at the Preliminary Hearing

Case Called @ 1:19 PM: Defendant Paul S. Schraven in court with attorney Matthew L. Goldin.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.  Argument as to bond reduction by Atty Goldin.  Argument as to bond by ADA - argues for bond to remain as previously ordered.  ADA states victim present and requests no contact be lifted.  Victim makes statement as to removal of bond condition.  Court declines to modify monetary conditions of bond.  Conditions amended to permit telephonic contact with J.G. so long as it is monitored by staff at the WCJ, text message contact allowed exclusively for the purposes of negotiating financial matters and concerns that have arisen.  Pre-Lim Scheduled Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 15, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Initial appearance on April 8, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
No contact with any female children under the age of 18 whatsoever. No possession of any electronic device capable of internet access.

Case called @ 1:03 p.m. Defendant Paul S. Schraven in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Bryan D. Keberlein.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD subject to verification. DA Blader requesting $7000 Cash Bond. Atty Keberlein requesting a signature bond. Court orders $5000 Cash Bond w/ conditions.  IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.
